reasoning_trace.description: The paper proposes a THz photonic-based ISAC system for fiber-wireless networks. It uses a thin-film lithium niobate Mach-Zehnder modulator (TFLN-MZM) for full-photonic direct reception and de-chirping of D-band LFM echo signals. The system achieves a range resolution of 6 mm and a peak data rate of 116 Gbit/s.

The system uses a TFLN-MZM for direct reception and de-chirping of THz LFM echo signals. The TFLN-MZM operates at the minimum transmission point (MITP), which provides optimal suppression of false targets. The system achieves a calibrated mean ranging error of less than 3 mm.

The paper demonstrates a photonic-based THz ISAC system for fiber-wireless networks. The system achieves a range resolution of 6 mm and a peak data rate of 116 Gbit/s. The impact of different fiber lengths on communication and radar sensing performance is assessed.

bibliographic.value: THz Integrated Sensing and Communication With Full-Photonic Direct LFM Reception and De-Chirping for D-Band Fiber-Wireless Network
Boyu Dong, Zhongya Li, Sizhe Xing, Yinjun Liu, Junhao Zhao, Ouhan Huang, Junlian Jia, Jianyang Shi, Yingjun Zhou, Haipeng Wang, Nan Chi, Junwen Zhang
IEEE Transactions on Microwave Theory and Techniques

enabling_tech.value: Full-photonic direct reception and de-chirping of THz LFM echo signals using a TFLN-MZM
